column5: Kinda reminds me of the Swedish chef on the Muppets.   <iframe width="640" height="360" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/Of0QP4o4ibU" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
I've been cleaning my perch(smaller than that one) like that for 25 years.Best way ever,fast and no waste.
I understand, Larry. My perch are a little smaller too.
Mmm, winter you must come faster.
Agreed. I'm looking forward to my seasonal perch harvest.  I didn't know you could dismantle perch rather than filet them.
Yeah my uncle showed me this technique a few years ago and I was converted.
Roy, Swedsh chef is so much cooler than these two.  Feeshy feesh!
In Europe perch (Perca fluviatilis) get much, much bigger.
As do the zander and pike.
It's all the wine Roy... it allows them to digest more food !
That was way cool. Gotta try that
If I tried that on the perch I generally catch I would probably break them in half and curse myself for just not filleting them. Sweet technique though!
Reminds me of this video we found when trying to remember how Nick showed us to filet our Perch! Haha!
